annotation.spannedText: DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine should be used as the booster dose for children at 4 to 6 years of age

classMention.mentionClass: DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine should be used as the booster dose for children at 4 to 6 years of age

annotation.spannedText: Children 7 years of age and older should receive the adolescent/adult formulation of diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-containing vaccine, with or without polio, (Tdap or Tdap-IPV) as it contains less diphtheria toxoid than preparations given to younger children and is less likely to cause reactions in older children

classMention.mentionClass: Children 7 years of age and older should receive the adolescent/adult formulation of diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-containing vaccine, with or without polio, (Tdap or Tdap-IPV) as it contains less diphtheria toxoid than preparations given to younger children and is less likely to cause reactions in older children

annotation.spannedText: Tdap vaccine should be administered to adolescents at 14 to16 years of age as the first 10-year booster dose; Tdap-IPV vaccine should be used if IPV vaccine is also indicated

classMention.mentionClass: Tdap vaccine should be administered to adolescents at 14 to16 years of age as the first 10-year booster dose; Tdap-IPV vaccine should be used if IPV vaccine is also indicated

annotation.spannedText: Adults who have not previously received a primary series (at least 3 doses) of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should receive one dose of Tdap-IPV vaccine followed by two doses of Td-IPV, vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Adults who have not previously received a primary series (at least 3 doses) of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should receive one dose of Tdap-IPV vaccine followed by two doses of Td-IPV, vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Children and adults lacking adequate documentation of immunization should be considered unimmunized and started on an immunization schedule appropriate for their age and risk factors

classMention.mentionClass: Children and adults lacking adequate documentation of immunization should be considered unimmunized and started on an immunization schedule appropriate for their age and risk factors

annotation.spannedText: Premature infants in stable clinical condition should be immunized with a tetanus toxoid-containing preparation at the same chronological age and according to the same schedule as full-term infants

classMention.mentionClass: Premature infants in stable clinical condition should be immunized with a tetanus toxoid-containing preparation at the same chronological age and according to the same schedule as full-term infants

annotation.spannedText: Hospitalized premature infants should have continuous cardiac and respiratory monitoring for 48 hours after their first immunization

classMention.mentionClass: Hospitalized premature infants should have continuous cardiac and respiratory monitoring for 48 hours after their first immunization

annotation.spannedText: People with neurological disorders with onset preceding immunization should receive all routinely recommended immunizations, including tetanus toxoid-containing preparations

classMention.mentionClass: People with neurological disorders with onset preceding immunization should receive all routinely recommended immunizations, including tetanus toxoid-containing preparations

annotation.spannedText: Unimmunized or incompletely immunized travellers should receive diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-polio-Hib-containing vaccine as appropriate for age

classMention.mentionClass: Unimmunized or incompletely immunized travellers should receive diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis-polio-Hib-containing vaccine as appropriate for age

annotation.spannedText: Health care providers who see people newly arrived in Canada should review the immunization status and update immunization for these individuals

classMention.mentionClass: Health care providers who see people newly arrived in Canada should review the immunization status and update immunization for these individuals

annotation.spannedText: All health care workers should be immune to tetanus and receive a booster dose of Td vaccine every 10 years as recommended for all adults

classMention.mentionClass: All health care workers should be immune to tetanus and receive a booster dose of Td vaccine every 10 years as recommended for all adults

annotation.spannedText: All health care and child care workers, regardless of age, should receive a single dose of Tdap vaccine for pertussis protection if they have not been immunised previously with this vaccine in adulthood, even if they are not due for a tetanus and diphtheria booster

classMention.mentionClass: All health care and child care workers, regardless of age, should receive a single dose of Tdap vaccine for pertussis protection if they have not been immunised previously with this vaccine in adulthood, even if they are not due for a tetanus and diphtheria booster

annotation.spannedText: Post-exposure prophylaxis of individuals who are unimmunized or incompletely immunized (unknown or fewer than 3 doses) and who sustain more than a minor, clean wound, should consist of both TIg and tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine (as appropriate for age and immunization history), given at different injection sites and using separate needles and syringes

classMention.mentionClass: Post-exposure prophylaxis of individuals who are unimmunized or incompletely immunized (unknown or fewer than 3 doses) and who sustain more than a minor, clean wound, should consist of both TIg and tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine (as appropriate for age and immunization history), given at different injection sites and using separate needles and syringes

annotation.spannedText: The vaccine series should be completed subsequently unless there is a contraindication

classMention.mentionClass: The vaccine series should be completed subsequently unless there is a contraindication

annotation.spannedText: People who have a tetanus-prone injury and have experienced a severe injection site reaction following a tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine usually have very high serum antitoxin levels and should not receive routine or emergency booster doses of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine for 10 years following the last dose

classMention.mentionClass: People who have a tetanus-prone injury and have experienced a severe injection site reaction following a tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine usually have very high serum antitoxin levels and should not receive routine or emergency booster doses of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine for 10 years following the last dose

annotation.spannedText: Individuals with humoral immune deficiency who have wounds that are not minor and clean should receive both TIg and tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine, regardless of the time elapsed since the last booster

classMention.mentionClass: Individuals with humoral immune deficiency who have wounds that are not minor and clean should receive both TIg and tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine, regardless of the time elapsed since the last booster

annotation.spannedText: Persons who have recovered from tetanus disease should receive tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine as recommended for people who not had the disease

classMention.mentionClass: Persons who have recovered from tetanus disease should receive tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine as recommended for people who not had the disease

annotation.spannedText: When used in the treatment of tetanus, TIg should be administered intramuscularly in an effort to neutralize tetanus toxin in body fluids

classMention.mentionClass: When used in the treatment of tetanus, TIg should be administered intramuscularly in an effort to neutralize tetanus toxin in body fluids

annotation.spannedText: The gluteal muscle should not be used as an injection site because of the risk of injury to the sciatic nerve

classMention.mentionClass: The gluteal muscle should not be used as an injection site because of the risk of injury to the sciatic nerve

annotation.spannedText: DTaP-IPV-Hib vaccine should be given at 2, 4, 6 and 12 to 23 months of age (generally given at 18 months of age)

classMention.mentionClass: DTaP-IPV-Hib vaccine should be given at 2, 4, 6 and 12 to 23 months of age (generally given at 18 months of age)

annotation.spannedText: Children less than 7 years of age not immunized in infancy: should receive three doses of DTaP-IPV (with or without Hib) vaccine with an interval of 8 weeks between doses, followed by a dose of DTaP-IPV vaccine 6 to 12 months after the third dose

classMention.mentionClass: Children less than 7 years of age not immunized in infancy: should receive three doses of DTaP-IPV (with or without Hib) vaccine with an interval of 8 weeks between doses, followed by a dose of DTaP-IPV vaccine 6 to 12 months after the third dose

annotation.spannedText: A booster dose of either DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine should be administered at 4 to 6 years of age (school entry)

classMention.mentionClass: A booster dose of either DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine should be administered at 4 to 6 years of age (school entry)

annotation.spannedText: Children who received a primary series) of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine and a booster dose 6-12 months later as outlined above should receive a booster dose of either DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine at 4 to 6 years of age (school entry); and, 10 years later, a booster dose of Tdap vaccine at 14 to 16 years of age

classMention.mentionClass: Children who received a primary series) of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine and a booster dose 6-12 months later as outlined above should receive a booster dose of either DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine at 4 to 6 years of age (school entry); and, 10 years later, a booster dose of Tdap vaccine at 14 to 16 years of age

annotation.spannedText: A booster dose of Tdap vaccine should be administered 10 years after the last dose

classMention.mentionClass: A booster dose of Tdap vaccine should be administered 10 years after the last dose

annotation.spannedText: Adults who have not previously received a primary series (at least 3 doses) of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should receive one dose of Tdap-IPV vaccine and two doses of Td-IPV vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Adults who have not previously received a primary series (at least 3 doses) of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should receive one dose of Tdap-IPV vaccine and two doses of Td-IPV vaccine

annotation.spannedText: The dose of Tdap-IPV vaccine should be given first, followed 8 weeks later by a dose of Td-IPV vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: The dose of Tdap-IPV vaccine should be given first, followed 8 weeks later by a dose of Td-IPV vaccine

annotation.spannedText: The second dose of Td-IPV vaccine should be given 6 to 12 months after the previous dose of Td-IPV vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: The second dose of Td-IPV vaccine should be given 6 to 12 months after the previous dose of Td-IPV vaccine

annotation.spannedText: The preschool booster dose of either DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine should be administered at 4 to 6 years of age

classMention.mentionClass: The preschool booster dose of either DTaP-IPV or Tdap-IPV vaccine should be administered at 4 to 6 years of age

annotation.spannedText: Adolescents should routinely receive a booster dose of Tdap vaccine at 14 to 16 years of age

classMention.mentionClass: Adolescents should routinely receive a booster dose of Tdap vaccine at 14 to 16 years of age

annotation.spannedText: Adults who have not received an adult dose of pertussis-containing vaccine should receive one dose of Tdap vaccine, which can be administered regardless of the interval since the last dose of tetanus and diphtheria toxoid-containing vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: Adults who have not received an adult dose of pertussis-containing vaccine should receive one dose of Tdap vaccine, which can be administered regardless of the interval since the last dose of tetanus and diphtheria toxoid-containing vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Tetanus toxoid-containing preparations should be stored in a refrigerator at +2째C to +8째C and must not be frozen

classMention.mentionClass: Tetanus toxoid-containing preparations should be stored in a refrigerator at +2째C to +8째C and must not be frozen

annotation.spannedText: Persons experiencing severe injection site reactions usually have very high serum antitoxin concentrations and should not receive further routine doses of Td vaccine for at least 10 years

classMention.mentionClass: Persons experiencing severe injection site reactions usually have very high serum antitoxin concentrations and should not receive further routine doses of Td vaccine for at least 10 years

annotation.spannedText: Administration of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should be postponed in persons with severe acute illness

classMention.mentionClass: Administration of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should be postponed in persons with severe acute illness

annotation.spannedText: People who experience a severe injection site reaction following a dose of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should not be given another dose for at least 10 years

classMention.mentionClass: People who experience a severe injection site reaction following a dose of tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should not be given another dose for at least 10 years

annotation.spannedText: The primary series of three doses tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should be completed with an appropriate vaccine from the same manufacturer whenever possible

classMention.mentionClass: The primary series of three doses tetanus toxoid-containing vaccine should be completed with an appropriate vaccine from the same manufacturer whenever possible
